body: I met the relevant issue. I use `pm2 start app.js --next-gen-js` too, and it always show `errored` without any error messages, but I use `babel-node app.js` directly, it works. I'm confusing.

From what I understand you can either:
- run an ES6 script with babel-node, using nodejs in `fork_mode` (or simply change `exec_interpreter`)
- run an ES6 script in cluster mode only with iojs

Note that on cluster mode we call the [register hook](https://github.com/Unitech/PM2/blob/e26aa9df8cf3b6e6214085a91e0281ffce5d4e41/lib/ProcessContainer.js#L101).

@Unitech am I missing something here?

I'm also having issues (as of today) using babel-node through PM2. From my PM2 logs, the relevant issue appears to be:

```
Starting execution sequence in -fork mode- for app name:server id:0
PM2: 2015-07-22 06:07:14: App name:server id:0 online
PM2: 2015-07-22 06:07:14: Error: spawn /usr/local/lib/node_modules/pm2/node_modules/babel/bin/babel-node ENOENT
```

The file `/usr/local/lib/node_modules/pm2/node_modules/babel/bin/babel-node.js` definitely exists. Almost as though PM2 isn't correctly detecting the .js extension.

I don't know if this is related to OP's issue, or if anyone has any help to offer. If not sorry to hijack this issue.

issue.title: app with babel-node keeps restarting

repository.name: pm2
repository.description: Node.js Production Process Manager with a built-in Load Balancer.

issue.body:
Hi, I'm using pm2 with babel-node interpreter and I find it impossible to kill the app once it has started. I first noticed that reloading after code changes didn't work and logs showed 

```
PM2 Change detected for app name: insights-dev - restarting
PM2 Stopping app:insights-dev id:0
PM2 App name:insights-dev id:0 exited with code SIGTERM
PM2 Process with pid 17912 killed
PM2 Starting execution sequence in -fork mode- for app name:insights-dev id:0
PM2 App name:insights-dev id:0 online
insights-dev-0 Port 3000 is already in use
```

in repeat.

After checking `pm2 ls`, I see this:

```

 App name      id  mode  pid    status  restart  uptime  memory       watching 

 insights-dev  0   fork  18495  online  26       2s      18.605 MB     enabled 

```

and the restart number keeps going up.

Even if I run `pm2 delete all` and `pm2 kill`, if I then try to restart the app, I'll have the same problem and I can see the process running with `ps aux | grep babel-node'

```
17938   0.0  1.1  3179668 180928   ??  S     8:42pm   0:04.44 node /usr/local/lib/node_modules/babel/lib/_babel-node
```

I think this might be related to [#1444](https://github.com/Unitech/PM2/issues/1444) but the fix does not work for me. I've tried with pm2 installed locally, globally, both and the same for babel.

Any ideas? What more info could I provide to help you identify the problem?

Edit:

To clarify, I'm running pm2 from a dev.json file, with only options being: 

```
"autorestart": true,
"exec_interpreter": "babel-node",
```
